DUSHYANTA.mapping: Dushyant Malhotra, big-shot Bollywood producer from Mumbai

DUSHYANTA.voice: charming but serious, falls hard when he falls

SHAKOONTALA.mapping: Shakuntala, classical dance teacher at small academy in Shimla
SHAKOONTALA.status: orphan raised by Kanva uncle who runs the academy
SHAKOONTALA.problem: talented but no connections to industry, never been to Mumbai

MATHAVYA.mapping: Mathavya, Dushyant's driver and childhood friend
MATHAVYA.role: comic relief, gives relationship advice, complains about mountain roads

ring.what_it_does: proof of serious commitment, not just filmi promises

narrative_constraints.ring_give_action: Dushyant MUST give the family engagement ring to Shakuntala

narrative_constraints.ring_she_has: Shakuntala HAS the engagement ring (from previous scene)
narrative_constraints.ring_no_return: Shakuntala does NOT give the ring back to Dushyant
narrative_constraints.ring_he_pines: Dushyant is distracted/pining for SHAKUNTALA HERSELF, not for the ring back
narrative_constraints.ring_no_ask: NO dialogue about 'refusing to return' - he gave it willingly
narrative_constraints.ring_waiting: Dushyant yearns for SHAKUNTALA TO COME TO MUMBAI, not for ring return
narrative_constraints.ring_proof: The ring is WITH HER as proof he'll come back for her
narrative_constraints.ring_union: The ring validates their SECRET ENGAGEMENT (families don't know yet)
narrative_constraints.ring_consensual: NO conflict about returning ring - this is mutual love

narrative_constraints.private_setting: PRIVATE moment, just the two of them
narrative_constraints.consensual_note: MUTUAL love, both falling for each other, no forced drama
narrative_constraints.comic_tone: Comic tone: Mathavya complains about mountain roads and gives unsolicited love advice
narrative_constraints.system_prompt: You are a Bollywood romance adapter. Keep the emotional beats but make it feel like a Shah Rukh Khan movie - dramatic, romantic, with meaningful silences and big gestures. The ring is his MOTHER'S ring, very significant.
